source.ed236156:
import pandas as pd

df = pd.read_csv('../input/nutritional-content-of-cereals/cereal.csv', skiprows=[1])
df = df.query('sugars>10 & weight<=1')  # heavy cereals have real food in them
df.sort_values('sugars', ascending=False)
source.0eb7720e: This is a very simple EDA effort to satisfy my curiosity. The cereals kids love to eat are high in artificial sugar (no surprise there).
